title: Easeout Weekly #12
body:
![CSS Contain Squares](/images/uploads/containment.png) [Let‚Äôs Take a Deep Dive Into the CSS Contain Property](https://css-tricks.com/lets-take-a-deep-dive-into-the-css-contain-property/) An exploration of the CSS contain property, which we can use to help the browser figure out what calculations it can reduce in priority or maybe even skip altogether - to load faster pages! [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/lets-take-a-deep-dive-into-the-css-contain-property/)
![Vue Survey Tutorial Author](/images/uploads/vue-survey-app-firebase-authentication-database.png) [How To Build A Vue Survey App Using Firebase Authentication And Database](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/vue-survey-app-firebase-authentication-database/) A tutorial to take you from validating user data through Vuelidate, to authentication, storing the user‚Äôs data, route protection and sending data to Firebase servers. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/vue-survey-app-firebase-authentication-database/)
![MDX Logo](/images/uploads/mdx-logo.png) [Working With MDX Custom Elements and Shortcodes](https://css-tricks.com/working-with-mdx-custom-elements-and-shortcodes/) A look at how we can customize MDX by replacing Markdown elements with our own MDX components & how we can add shortcodes. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/working-with-mdx-custom-elements-and-shortcodes/)
![Biased Design Decision](/images/uploads/biased-design-decision.png) [Reducing Design Risk](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/reducing-design-risk/) Some solid practical advice on how to create designs that better serve customers and the company: context over convenience, compromise, better design decisions, design reduction. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/reducing-design-risk/)
![Tetris Blocks](/images/uploads/tetris-blocks.png) [How to Use Block Variations in WordPress](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-use-block-variations-in-wordpress/) An overview of block variations introduced in WordPress 5.4. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/how-to-use-block-variations-in-wordpress/)
![Tablist Arrows](/images/uploads/accordions-cogs.png) [The Anatomy of a Tablist Component in Vanilla JavaScript Versus React](https://css-tricks.com/the-anatomy-of-a-tablist-component-in-vanilla-javascript-versus-react/) A comparison between the framework everyone loves (to hate?) React vs VanillaJS when creating a Tablist component. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/the-anatomy-of-a-tablist-component-in-vanilla-javascript-versus-react/)
![Smashing Tobi](/images/uploads/smashingconf-dj-tobi.png) [Meet SmashingConf Live: Our New Interactive Online Conference](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/smashingconf-live-release/) A ook at what's planned for SmashingConf Live (June 9‚Äì10). With interactive live sessions, practical insights, accessible speakers, collaborative notes and friendly fireplace chats with like-minded folks. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/smashingconf-live-release/)
![Custom List](/images/uploads/custom-list-style.jpg) [List Style Recipes](https://css-tricks.com/list-style-recipes/) A look at a number of ways we can style & work with HTML lists. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://css-tricks.com/list-style-recipes/)
![Vue Rocketship](/images/uploads/rocket-vue.png) [Control a Rocket üöÄ Ship with Vue](https://codepen.io/JackDomleo/full/qBOpbKe) This fun demo by Jack Domleo lets you control a vue powered rocket ship! [Check it out ‚û°Ô∏è](https://codepen.io/JackDomleo/full/qBOpbKe)
![css macintosh 128k](/images/uploads/macintosh.png) [CSS macintosh 128k](https://codepen.io/luckybusted/details/bGVrgJY) A wobbling macintosh coded in pure CSS by Ivan Ushmorov. [See it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://codepen.io/luckybusted/details/bGVrgJY)
![Vitaly Freidman Podcast Chat](/images/uploads/vitaly-smashing.png) [Vitaly Freidman and Smashing Magazine in 2020](https://shoptalkshow.com/411/) Vitaly Friedman talks about the changing landscape of publishing on the web, the changes seen in web conferences, the difference between a workshop and a webinar and keeping up with front end! [Listen up ‚û°Ô∏è](https://shoptalkshow.com/411/)
![React and Ionic Logos](/images/uploads/ionic-react.jpg) [An Introduction To React With Ionic](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/introduction-react-ionic/) In this tutorial, we‚Äôll see how to build a mobile application that pulls data from the Marvel Comics API; the data will show Marvel comics and you‚Äôll be able to choose your favorites. At the end, we‚Äôll create a native build of the project on Android. [Read it ‚û°Ô∏è](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/introduction-react-ionic/)
## Previous Issue: * [Easeout Weekly #11](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-05-03-easeout-weekly-11)
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
